trans-unit.source: Represents the class that describes how to marshal a field from managed to unmanaged code.
This class cannot be inherited.
The code example shows the workaround for this obsolete type.
Marshaling is the process of packaging and unpackaging parameters so remote procedure calls can occur.
During marshaling, a field might undergo a format conversion when the format of the managed type is different from the format of the corresponding unmanaged type.
For example, you might want to marshal a `String` type as an unmanaged BSTR.
Some format conversions are handled automatically by the runtime.
To override the default behavior, you must use the `UnmanagedMarshal` class to define the format conversion.
Gets an unmanaged base type.
This property is read-only.
An `UnmanagedType` object.
The unmanaged type is not an `LPArray` or a `SafeArray`.
Specifies a fixed-length array (ByValArray) to marshal to unmanaged code.
The `DefineByValArray` method is not a simple native marshal.
Only unmanaged marshal constructs can be made using these static constructors.
Marshaling an array is a more complex process than marshaling an integer parameter.
Array members are copied in a specific order so that the other side can reconstruct the array exactly.
The number of elements in the fixed-length array.
An <xref href="System.Reflection.Emit.UnmanagedMarshal"></xref> object.
The argument is not a simple native type.
Specifies a string in a fixed array buffer (ByValTStr) to marshal to unmanaged code.
The `DefineByValStr` method is not a simple native marshal.
Only unmanaged marshal constructs can be made using these static constructors.
Marshaling an array is a more complex process than marshaling an integer parameter.
Array members are copied in a specific order so that the other side can reconstruct the array exactly.
The number of elements in the fixed array buffer.
An <xref href="System.Reflection.Emit.UnmanagedMarshal"></xref> object.
The argument is not a simple native type.
Specifies an `LPArray` to marshal to unmanaged code.
The length of an `LPArray` is determined at runtime by the size of the actual marshaled array.
The `DefineLPArray` method is not a simple native marshal.
Only unmanaged marshal constructs can be made using these static constructors.
Marshaling an array is a more complex process than marshaling an integer parameter.
Array members are copied in a specific order so that the other side can reconstruct the array exactly.
The unmanaged type to which to marshal the array.
An <xref href="System.Reflection.Emit.UnmanagedMarshal"></xref> object.
The argument is not a simple native type.
Specifies a `SafeArray` to marshal to unmanaged code.
The `DefineSafeArray` method is not a simple native marshal.
Only unmanaged marshal constructs can be made using these static constructors.
Marshaling an array is a more complex process than marshaling an integer parameter.
Array members are copied in a specific order so that the other side can reconstruct the array exactly.
The base type or the `UnmanagedType` of each element of the array.
An <xref href="System.Reflection.Emit.UnmanagedMarshal"></xref> object.
The argument is not a simple native type.
Specifies a given type that is to be marshaled to unmanaged code.
The <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType> passed to this method must be a simple native type.

None of the following values may be used: <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType?displayProperty=fullName>, or <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType?displayProperty=fullName>.
Only unmanaged marshal constructs can be made using this method.
The unmanaged type to which the type is to be marshaled.
An <xref href="System.Reflection.Emit.UnmanagedMarshal"></xref> object.
The argument is not a simple native type.
Gets a number element.
This property is read-only.
There is an `ElementCount` only if there is a `NativeTypeFixedArray`.
An integer indicating the element count.
The argument is not an unmanaged element count.
Indicates an unmanaged type.
This property is read-only.
The `GetUnmanagedType` property is an accessor function for the native type.
An <xref href="System.Runtime.InteropServices.UnmanagedType"></xref> object.
Gets a GUID.
This property is read-only.
This property always returns Guid.Empty.
This property might be removed in a future release.
A <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> object.
The argument is not a custom marshaler.
